DataElement.preferredName: Protocol Deviation Performed Observation Outcome Occurrence Date and Time Range ISO21090.IVL.TS.DATETIME.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The date and time span specifying when the protocol deviation began and ended.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Protocol Deviation Performed Observation Outcome Occurrence Date and Time Range
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An unintended departure from the study plan which has not been prospectively reviewed and approved by the IRB and FDA.:Executed and carried through to completion.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:The result of an action._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.:An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.:The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An unintended departure from the study plan which has not been prospectively reviewed and approved by the IRB and FDA.:Executed and carried through to completion.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: A variation from processes or procedures defined in a protocol. Deviations usually do not preclude the overall evaluability of subject data for either efficacy or safety, and are often acknowledged and accepted in advance by the sponsor. (CDISC Glossary)
Executed and carried through to completion.
Watching something and taking note of what happens.

Property.preferredDefinition: An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.:An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.:The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.

Concepts.definition: An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.
An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.
The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Set of consecutive values of an ordered base datatype of the type TS.DATETIME.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
